section.title: Full Immunization
section.p: Recall that we defined the function h as:
Redington immunization required that the interest rate at time 0, \iota_0, be a local minimum of h. Liabilities are said to be fully immunized if \iota_0 is a global minimum of h.

statement.p: Explain, practically, the difference between Redington and full immunization.
Identify a condition on h'' that is sufficient for \iota_0 to be a global minimum of h (you do not have to prove or justify this -- a proof requires real analysis).

section.p: Full immunization can be difficult to verify. We are only going to consider one way full immunization can be achieved. We will show that if there is exactly one liability L_s at time s, and zero-coupon bonds with face values A_1 coming due at time t_1 and A_2 coming due at time t_2, with t_1 < s < t_2 satisfying the conditions of Redington immunization, then the liability is full immunized.

introduction.p: Let's see why this is true. First, consider the general case with several liabilities and several assets. Let D(\iota_0) be the Macaulay duration of the portfolio of liabilities.

task.p: Show that the duration condition of Redington immunization implies that D(\iota_0) is also the duration of the portfolio of assets.
Show that regarding the convexity condition:
task.me: \sum t^2 A_t v^t > \sum t^2 L_t v^t \iff \sum (t - D(\iota_0))^2 A_t v^t > \sum (t - D(\iota_0))^2 L_t v^t

task.p: Now suppose we have a single liability at time s in the amount L_s. This is equivalent to owing a zero-coupon bond. What is D(\iota_0)?

Show that if our liability portfolio has a single liability of amount L_s we have assets consisting of exactly two zero-coupon bonds, with face values A_1 coming due at time t_1 and A_2 coming due at time t_2 (neither t_1 nor t_2 equal s), then the convexity condition is satisfied for all \iota.

Show that if there is exactly one liability L_s at time s, and zero-coupon bonds with face values A_1 coming due at time t_1 and A_2 coming due at time t_2, with t_1 < s < t_2 satisfying the present value and duration matching conditions of Redington immunization, then the liability is full immunized (you may have to skip a couple of details near the end of your work).

section.p: Note that our argument did not use the condition t_1 < s < t_2 (except to the extent that t_1 \neq s and t_2 \neq s). This condition is required for A_1 and A_2 to be positive (otherwise they would not be assets). The nicest way to see why this is true is to use some linear algebra -- see the challenge question at the end of this activity.

statement.p: A single liability of 250,000 will come due at the end of year 8. To immunize these liabilities at \iota_0 = 5\%, the firm purchases a zero coupon bond of amount A_1 maturing at time 4 and a second zero-coupon bond of amount A_2 maturing at time 11. Find A_1 and A_2, and determine if the liability is fully immunized.

Jia Wen has a liability of 12,000 due in eight years. This liability will be met with payments of 5000 in five years and B in 8+b years. Jia Wen is employing a full immunization strategy using an annual effective interest rate of 3%.
Explain why full immunization is desirable.
